name: Avicenna Hotel

reviews.text: We had to squeeze our 3 children into one room...it was tight, but the room was clean, the staff friendly, and the location great (although we had to walk up hill to the sights every day).
reviews.title: Solid 4...small for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can concur with the majority of positive revues already posted but as many others found there are a number of very poor rooms. Those located down the 3 flights of stairs, although well presented are very small with shoe boxes for bathrooms. The biggest problem, however, is the busy railway line about 5 paces from your window. If you make a big enough fuss they will change you, probably the next day.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay IF you get the right room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rest of the hotel is fine with quality fittings but don't expect too much space. It is well situated in a pleasant area and within minutes walk of some of the biggest sights.and dozens of restaurants.
reviews.title: Brilliant weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got an excellent deal to go to this hotel online for 3nts.I emailed the hotel for transfer and also told them I wanted smoking room.Their response was very quick and as non-smoking hotel reserved room with balcony :). Room given was very good,abit on the small side but have been to Istanbul before and I don't think you get big rooms anyway. I was a bit wary of the complaints re; railway and Yes you can hear the trains from practically all rooms I think -but this was not a problem to us.Hotel in excellent position for the "must sees" although we went purposefully to do Bospherous cruise and to visit friends.The breakfast (is downstairs in a very pleasant room with garden attached) and consisted of cereals,bread/toast,cold meats,cheeses and biscuits/pastries,fruit,so no need to go hungry. The restaurant/bar looked lovely with great views on balcony but we never made it there-haha- have to go again!!!
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have recently spent 5 days at the Avicenna on a recommendation and have to say the overall experience was a great one. We originally were booked in a room on the second floor, but as my husband has a back problem and found the steps difficult the staff went out of their way to get us another room on the first floor. We found the staff to be extremely helpfull and pleasant, the breakfast adequate and the rooms spotless. Like most "European" hotel rooms they are on the "compact" side, but only because we are used to much larger room size in New Zealand.
reviews.title: Be careful which room you get

reviews.text: Such a mixed bag for this hotel. First the bad stiff. We were put into room B04. This was a single room with the bed turned sideways and a collapsable camp bed laid alongside. When I complained that we had booked a double room I was informed that this really was a double but that a new room could be made available the following day. 1 hour later when talking about the problem with friends in the lobby and our steps to complain to Jules Verne, the travel company, miraculously a new bedroom was offered.
reviews.title: Style over substance

reviews.text: The second bed room was room 115 which as you'll realise from the other reviews is 5 metres from a railway line which runs from 5.45am till gone midnight. Good luck getting a relaxing holiday sleep here. The rooms are all nicely decorated but with zero thoughts about where the lights should be, the shelf over the sink [revents you from using it and the safe was inoperable.
reviews.title: A Lovely hotel if you get a nice room

reviews.text: Its a shame because the bar staff were friendly and engaging and the location near to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia is excellent.
reviews.title: Family-home

reviews.text: The restaurant evening food was very poor and we would recommend against. We'd recommend the Oceans Seven restaurant just around the corner where the service and food were excellent.
reviews.title: Trainspotting Heaven

reviews.text: We booked 2 excellence rooms, our friends received this level of room immediately and we were told we would be transferred into one the following day. (No refund for the one night!). Our first room was a reasonable size and looked out over the street. Our friends room had a stunning view out over the water but was small. Additionally, their air conditioning didn't work and it was always tomorrow it would be repaired, needless to say it never was. All the balconies are small and fully open to your neigbours balcony, however, it is nice to have access to the open air.
reviews.title: AWFUL ROOMS, AWFUL MEALS.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, we seldomly complain about the quality of our hotels but please read this so you can spend your money elsewhere.
reviews.title: Just like sleeping on a railway track

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our 3rd visit to Istanbul and our experience at this hotel was terrible. We were enroute back to London after 9 lovely days in the regional Turkey and thought I would treat my family to a boutique hotel on our last night
reviews.title: a very mixed experience

description: Throughout your stay you will discover the cultural riches of Istanbul while indulging in the wellknown Turkish hospitality. That‘s our aim: to include the perfect service touches in a wonderful setting that take and ordinary vacation to extraordinary memories.
